data.title: Real Blues in the Suburbs
data.text:
Arcadia Blues Club books top regional (and sometimes national) blues acts in it's roomy space with two stages, big dance floor, bar, kitchen and two pool tables.  The food is reliable tavern fare, the cover charges are fair and the drinks are good. 

Most importantly, the owners are really devoted to blues music.  Co-owner, "Bobby Bluehouse," plays drums in the house host band that often includes real starts sitting in, and he books the best of local talent, too.

If you're in the Arcadia/Pasadena/San Gabriel Vallely area looking for some blues, this is a good choice, and during a break wander a few doors East to the First Cabin, a bar where inveterate blues band Pat O'Brian and the Priests of Love rock some lively blues, too!

data.title: Great blues joint
data.text: Located on Huntington Drive just a few blocks from Santa Anita Park.  The food was decent enough when you add the blues music.  Bobby Bluehouse is the house band and are just fine.  They open for a headliner on the weekends.  Small intimate club with great sound and good drinks.  It makes me think of an upgraded road house in the South.  I believe all live music is good and this place features some of the best acts in California and the Blues world

data.title: Bues, blues, blues
data.text: Been going to this club for years and have some mixed feelings.  The music has always been outstanding, up to and including the house band, Bobby Blueshouse.  Last night was no exception with "City Beat" the featured band.  The place was packed, a little to packed as it turned out getting in and out from the tables truly sucked, but great for the club I suppose.  Although you can dance at the club, it has become more about listening to music, which is ok, but I'm a dancer and must admit I enjoyed the club far more in it's earlier dive bar, dance incarnation.  Still a great place to hear live music, just not as great to dance to it.

data.title: Fans of the blues bar rejoice!
data.text: Anybody who was a fan of the old Cozy's Bar & Grill will love this place. Many of the bands who frequented Cozy's (BB Chung King and the Buddaheads, Coco Montoya, etc.) have set up shop at ABC. The have also attracted larger name players like Johnny Winter and Charlie Musselwhite to the club. Despite this, the cover price is usually around 20 or less, even less online. The drinks are about average price for a bar/club. On my last visit, the house band played two 40 minute sets and the headliner played two hour long sets. While the headliner took a break, the house band played. This was not a bad setup because the house band, Bobby Bluehouse, played fantastic cover versions of classic songs. Of course the place is not the prettiest venue or has the best sound system but that's part of the beauty of it. The little imperfections gives it a nice atmosphere. If you love great music in an intimate setting, this is   the place.

data.title: Great music at a great price
data.text: I would consider this one of the great "local dives".  The inside is just tables and almost folding chairs.  Very simple.  So don't go there for the atmosphere but rather go for the music.  It's a small cover charge.   They have a house band that plays first, and then the headliner.  It's a bit loud so consider some ear plugs if you might be uncomfortable.   Drink prices are $5.  They have some food but I didn't have any.

data.title: Música excelente, comida e bebida ruins
data.text: O ideal é comer algo antes de ir para lá. O lugar, como estabelecimento comercial, é muito fraco, mas a música é surpreendente. Tem dois palcos que recebem a banda da casa e uma banda convidada. Quando uma acaba, a outra já entra logo em seguida, então, a música não pára de 21h até meia-noite. Para quem curte Blues, é muito bom. O preço do ingresso é ridículo: 5 dólares. O melhor seria entrar de olhos vendados e pedir apenas uma cerveja, pois nem o vinho é possível tomar sem fazer cara feia!
